message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and CSF analysis suggest meningitis caused by Neisseria meningitidis. Complications can include adrenal insufficiency, which is a life-threatening condition that can present with shock, hypotension, and metabolic acidosis. The other options are not commonly associated with meningitis caused by Neisseria meningitidis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and CSF analysis suggest bacterial meningitis, which can cause adrenal insufficiency as a complication due to damage to the adrenal gland. The other options are not commonly associated with meningitis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and CSF analysis suggest bacterial meningitis, and gram-negative diplococci suggest Neisseria meningitidis as the most likely causative organism. Adrenal insufficiency is a potential complication of meningococcal disease, which can lead to shock and even death. Temporal lobe inflammation, acute pancreatitis, and deep neck abscess are not commonly associated with meningococcal disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and CSF analysis suggest bacterial meningitis. Bacterial meningitis can cause adrenal insufficiency as a complication. The other options are not typical complications of bacterial meningitis.

This infection can cause adrenal insufficiency as a complication. None of the other options are associated with this specific infection.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest that the boy has meningitis caused by Neisseria meningitidis, which can cause sepsis and adrenal insufficiency. The other complications listed are not typically associated with this type of meningitis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and CSF analysis suggest bacterial meningitis, caused by gram-negative diplococci, which can lead to adrenal insufficiency as a complication. None of the other complications are commonly associated with bacterial meningitis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and CSF analysis suggest meningitis caused by Neisseria meningitidis. The patient is at risk for adrenal insufficiency as this bacteria can release endotoxins that can cause adrenal gland dysfunction. The other options are not typically associated with meningitis caused by Neisseria meningitidis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and CSF analysis suggest bacterial meningitis, which puts the patient at risk for adrenal insufficiency due to the high levels of inflammation and cytokines that can affect the adrenal glands. The other options are not commonly associated with bacterial meningitis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and CSF analysis suggest bacterial meningitis, and gram-negative diplococci indicate Neisseria meningitidis. Patients with Neisseria meningitidis are at risk for adrenal insufficiency due to endotoxin-induced diffuse intravascular coagulation. Temporal lobe inflammation, acute pancreatitis, and deep neck abscess are not typical complications of bacterial meningitis caused by Neisseria meningitidis.
